title: Linear Regression
question_text:
Which statements is/are true concerning linear regression?

I. One can take the $\log$ of the $x$ and $y$-values to transform an exponential relationship into a linear relationship. II. If the original data is of exponential form, one can increase the correlation coefficient, $r$, by transforming the data to linear form. III. As long as there is a strong correlation ($|r| > 0.7$), the data is most likely linear.
